title: What is Apper?
description: Learn how Apper works as your AI assistant for building complete applications
content:
Welcome to Apper! Think of Apper as your friendly AI chat assistant that builds full apps based on what you tell it. You don't need to write code, pick templates, or connect different tools â€” Apper handles everything in one place.

Imagine describing your app idea to a tech-savvy friend who can instantly build it for you. That's exactly what Apper does! You simply type what you want (like "Make a booking app for my restaurant"), and Apper creates a complete, working application.

Unlike other tools that require technical knowledge or force you to choose from limited templates, Apper understands natural language and builds custom solutions from scratch. It's like having a full development team that works instantly and speaks your language.

The magic happens through conversation. You describe your needs, Apper asks clarifying questions if needed, and then builds your app while explaining what it's doing. No coding required, no technical jargon â€” just plain English conversations that result in professional applications.

title: Why Apper Stands Out
description: Discover what makes Apper unique in the world of app building platforms
content:
What makes Apper special is its all-in-one approach. While other platforms make you juggle multiple tools, services, and integrations, Apper manages everything seamlessly in one place.

Traditional app building requires you to:
- Choose and learn a specific platform
- Connect databases separately
- Set up payment processing
- Handle user authentication
- Manage hosting and deployment
- Learn complex interfaces

With Apper, all of this happens automatically through natural conversation. You focus on describing what you want, and Apper handles the technical complexity behind the scenes.

The conversation-based flow means you're never stuck wondering "what button do I click next?" Instead, you simply tell Apper what you need: "Add a payment system" or "Let users upload photos" and it happens instantly.

Apper also learns from your feedback. If something isn't quite right, you can say "make that button bigger" or "change the color to blue" and watch your app update in real-time. It's like pair programming with an AI that never gets tired or frustrated.

title: Create Your First App
description: Step-by-step guide to building your first application with simple prompts
content:
Ready to build your first app? Start simple and be specific. Here's how:

Step 1: Think of a real problem you want to solve
Don't start with "I want to build Facebook." Instead, think smaller: "I need to track my gym workouts" or "I want customers to book appointments online."

Step 2: Write a clear, simple prompt
Good examples:
- "Make a booking app for a hair salon with calendar view and customer info"
- "Create a quiz game about world capitals with scoring"
- "Build a simple inventory tracker for my small store"

Step 3: Use ChatGPT to improve your prompt (Pro tip!)
If you're unsure about your prompt, ask ChatGPT: "Help me write a detailed prompt for Apper to create [your app idea]. I need it to include [list your must-have features]."

ChatGPT will help you structure a comprehensive prompt that gives Apper all the context it needs.

Step 4: Submit your prompt to Apper
Paste your improved prompt into Apper and watch the magic happen! Apper will start building immediately and show you progress in real-time.

Remember: You can always refine and improve your app after it's created. Start with the basics and add features as you go.

title: The Apper Builder Interface
description: Navigate through Apper's four main sections and understand their purposes
content:
Once Apper creates your app, you'll see four main sections in the builder interface. Each serves a specific purpose:

1. Customize App
This is where you fine-tune your app's appearance and functionality. You can:
- Adjust colors, fonts, and layout
- Modify forms and input fields
- Change button text and positioning
- Upload logos and images
- Preview changes instantly

2. Manage App
This section handles the business side of your app:
- Set up user permissions and roles
- Configure signup and login methods
- Manage email notifications
- Set up pricing and billing
- Control who can access what

3. Code (Optional)
Most users never need this section, but it's there if you want to:
- Add custom functionality
- Integrate with external services
- Fine-tune performance
- Export your app code

Remember: Apper handles all the coding automatically, so this section is purely optional for advanced users.

4. Database
Apper automatically creates and manages your database, but here you can:
- View all your app's data
- Export data to spreadsheets
- Set up data relationships
- Configure automatic backups

The beauty is that Apper sets up everything automatically. These sections just give you control when you want to customize further.

title: App Versions
description: Master version control to safely experiment and restore previous app states
content:
One of Apper's most powerful features is automatic version control. Every change you make creates a new version, giving you complete freedom to experiment without fear.

How Versions Work:
Every time you ask Apper to make a change, it saves the current state as a version before implementing the new feature. This means you have a complete history of your app's evolution.

Version Features:
- Automatic saving with timestamps
- Descriptive names for each change
- One-click switching between versions
- Full preview of any previous version
- Instant restoration to any point

Switching Between Versions:
1. Go to the "Versions" tab in your app builder
2. Browse through your version history
3. Click "Preview" to see any version
4. Click "Restore" to go back to that version
5. Continue working from that point

Version Best Practices:
- Make one change at a time for cleaner version history
- Add descriptive comments when making major changes
- Test new features before making additional changes
- Use preview mode to compare versions side-by-side

Why Versions Are Powerful:
- Experiment fearlessly knowing you can always go back
- Show stakeholders different options
- Recover from mistakes instantly
- Track the evolution of your ideas
- Create branching paths for different use cases

Example Workflow:
Let's say you have a booking app and want to try a different layout:
1. Current version: "Basic booking form"
2. Make changes: "Add calendar widget"
3. Preview and test the new version
4. If you like it, continue building
5. If not, restore to "Basic booking form" and try a different approach

Versions give you the confidence to innovate without consequences.

title: Manage App Settings
description: Configure app permissions, user access, and authentication methods
content:
The "Manage App" section is your control center for all the business and administrative aspects of your application. Here's how to use each feature effectively.

Renaming Your App:
1. Go to "App Settings" in the Manage section
2. Click "Edit App Name"
3. Choose a name that's clear and professional
4. This name appears in browser tabs and bookmarks

Managing Permissions:
Apper uses role-based permissions to control who can do what:

Admin Role:
- Full access to all features
- Can manage other users
- Can modify app settings
- Access to analytics and data

Editor Role:
- Can create and modify content
- Limited administrative access
- Cannot manage other users
- Cannot change app settings

User Role:
- Standard app functionality
- Cannot access admin features
- Can use all intended features
- Limited to their own data

Setting Up User Access:
1. Choose "User Management" in Manage App
2. Decide who can sign up:
   - Open registration (anyone can join)
   - Invitation only (you approve users)
   - Admin approval required
3. Set default role for new users
4. Configure email verification requirements

Login and Signup Methods:
Apper supports multiple authentication options:

Social Login:
- Google (most popular)
- Facebook
- LinkedIn
- GitHub (for technical apps)

Traditional Methods:
- Email and password
- Username and password
- Magic links (passwordless)

Two-Factor Authentication:
- SMS verification
- Email verification
- Authenticator apps

Best Practices:
- Start with email + Google for maximum compatibility
- Require email verification for security
- Use two-factor authentication for sensitive apps
- Keep registration simple to reduce barriers

title: Onboarding and Emails
description: Customize system emails and create smooth user onboarding experiences
content:
Great apps create great first impressions. Apper's email system helps you communicate professionally with users from their very first interaction.

Welcome Messages:

- Introduces app features

Customizing Email Templates:
1. Go to "Email Settings" in Manage App
2. Select the email type you want to customize
3. Modify:
   - Subject lines

   - Call-to-action buttons
   - Branding and colors

Email Best Practices:
Subject Lines:
- Keep them clear and specific
- Include your app name
- Create urgency when appropriate
- Avoid spam-trigger words

Content:
- Use friendly, conversational tone
- Include clear next steps
- Provide contact information
- Keep messages concise

Branding:
- Use your app's colors and fonts
- Include your logo
- Maintain consistent voice
- Match your app's design style

Onboarding Flow Example:
1. User signs up
2. Receives email confirmation
3. Clicks confirmation link
4. Gets welcome email with tutorial
5. Receives helpful tips over first week

Remember: Good email communication builds trust and reduces support requests by helping users understand your app from day one.

title: Billing and Revenue

Setting Up Pricing Tiers:
1. Go to "Billing Settings" in Manage App
2. Click "Create Pricing Plan"
3. Define each tier:

   - Monthly/annual price

Connecting Stripe:

2. In Apper, go to "Payment Settings"
3. Click "Connect Stripe Account"
4. Follow the authorization process
5. Configure payment methods:
   - Credit/debit cards

Revenue Features Apper Provides:
- Automatic invoice generation
- Tax calculation and collection

- Revenue analytics and reporting
- Customer billing portals
- Refund processing

Best Practices for Pricing:

Remember: Apper handles all the technical complexity of payments, so you can focus on creating value for your customers.

title: Database Setup
description: Understand automatic database configuration and app types for optimal permissions
content:
Apper automatically creates and configures your database, but understanding how it works helps you make better decisions about your app's structure.

Automatic Database Setup:
When you create an app, Apper automatically:
- Designs the database schema
- Creates all necessary tables
- Sets up relationships between data
- Configures security and permissions
- Optimizes for performance
- Enables automatic backups

Two Main App Types:
Employee-Facing Apps (Internal):
- Used by your team or organization
- Higher trust level
- More permissive data access
- Administrative features
- Detailed analytics
- Advanced functionality

Customer-Facing Apps (External):
- Used by your customers or public
- Restricted data access
- Privacy-focused permissions
- Limited administrative features
- Customer-friendly interfaces
- Security-first approach

How App Type Affects Database:
Employee Apps:
- Users can see more data
- Broader search capabilities
- Export functionality
- Detailed user information
- Cross-reference capabilities

Customer Apps:
- Users see only their own data
- Limited search scope
- Restricted export options
- Minimal user information
- Isolated data access

Database Features Apper Provides:
Automatic Relationships:
- Links related data automatically
- Maintains data integrity
- Optimizes query performance
- Handles complex associations

Security:
- Encrypted data storage
- Secure connections
- Access control
- Audit trails
- Regular security updates

Performance:
- Automatic indexing
- Query optimization
- Caching strategies
- Scalable architecture

Backups:
- Automatic daily backups
- Point-in-time recovery
- Disaster recovery
- Data export options

Best Practices:
- Choose app type carefully during setup
- Let Apper handle database design
- Focus on your data needs, not technical structure
- Trust Apper's security and performance optimizations

Remember: You don't need to understand databases to use Apper effectively. The AI handles all technical aspects while you focus on your business logic and user experience.
